author: Staff Reporter
text:
With a view to ensuring cent per cent voting in the May 16 Assembly election by spreading awareness, the district administration is taking various steps under Systematic Voters’ Education and Electoral Participation (SVEEP) programme.

As part of the exercise, District Election Officer Sajjansingh R. Chavan inaugurated a human chain formed by college students in front of the Collectorate here and distributed awareness pamphlets on Friday.

He said that the public could lodge their election-related complaints through toll-free number 1800 599 8010.

The Collector said that efforts were being taken to show awareness documentaries through video screen-fitted vans belonging to the Department of Information and Public Relations in the areas where voter turnout was low during the previous Lok Sabha and Assembly elections.

Over 1,000 students from S.T. Hindu College and Women’s Christian College participated in the human chain.

District Revenue Officer S. Elango, Nagercoil Returning Officer and RDO S. Madhiyazhagan and others participated.
title: Human chain for voters’ awareness formed
